## Description {#details}

DWARF expression.

This is (almost) a DWARF expression that modifies the location of a variable, or the location of a single piece of a variable, or (when using DW&#95;OP&#95;stack&#95;value) is the constant variable value.

TODO: Co-allocate the expression elements. TODO: Separate from <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a>, or otherwise drop Distinct and Temporary storage types.

Definition at line 2763 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h">DebugInfoMetadata.h</a>.

### extractLeadingOffset() {#aca8478c6263c444e06a6c80f0b3df98c}

Assuming that the expression operates on an address, extract a constant offset and the successive ops.

Return false if the expression contains any incompatible ops (including non-zero DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;args - only a single address operand to the expression is permitted).

We don&#39;t try very hard to interpret the expression because we assume that foldConstantMath has canonicalized the expression.

### getNumLocationOperands() {#a9aef6cbb464a57070a26cf422b979df9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t DIExpression::getNumLocationOperands () const</>}>
Return the number of unique location operands referred to (via DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg) in this expression; this is not necessarily the number of instances of DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg within the expression.

For example, for the expression: (DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg 0, DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg 1, DW&#95;OP&#95;plus, DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg 0, DW&#95;OP&#95;mul) This function would return 2, as there are two unique location operands (0 and 1).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h/#l02809">2809</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h">DebugInfoMetadata.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfometadata-cpp/#l02206">2206</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfometadata-cpp">DebugInfoMetadata.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getSingleLocationExpressionElements() {#ac93b77f1f537436cbb281bbc34b3bd96}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; ArrayRef&lt; uint64&#95;t &gt; &gt; DIExpression::getSingleLocationExpressionElements () const</>}>
Returns a reference to the elements contained in this expression, skipping past the leading <code>DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg, 0</code> if one is present.

Similar to <code>convertToNonVariadicExpression</code>, but faster and cheaper - it does not check whether the expression is a single-location expression, and it returns elements rather than creating a new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a>.

### append() {#a15f4de7989cc83855e8f65792ae94bc4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DIExpression &#42; DIExpression::append (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a> &#42; Expr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint64&#95;t &gt; Ops)</>}

Append the opcodes <code>Ops</code> to <code>DIExpr</code>.

Unlike <a href="#ac255b2b7ff59963227ea39e1d176f63a">appendToStack</a>, the returned expression is a stack value only if <code>DIExpr</code> is a stack value. If <code>DIExpr</code> describes a fragment, the returned expression will describe the same fragment.

### calculateFragmentIntersect() {#a4ea8623be899e029827af260965c860d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool DIExpression::calculateFragmentIntersect (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; SliceStart, uint64&#95;t SliceOffsetInBits, uint64&#95;t SliceSizeInBits, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; DbgPtr, int64&#95;t DbgPtrOffsetInBits, int64&#95;t DbgExtractOffsetInBits, <a href="#a2a09e6caba71ab15519f9e55ceb4d10d">DIExpression::FragmentInfo</a> VarFrag, std::optional&lt; <a href="#a2a09e6caba71ab15519f9e55ceb4d10d">DIExpression::FragmentInfo</a> &gt; &amp; Result, int64&#95;t &amp; OffsetFromLocationInBits)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Computes a fragment, bit-extract operation if needed, and new constant offset to describe a part of a variable covered by some memory.

See declaration for more info.

The memory region starts at: <code>SliceStart</code> + <code>SliceOffsetInBits</code> And is size: <code>SliceSizeInBits</code> 

The location of the existing variable fragment <code>VarFrag</code> is: <code>DbgPtr</code> + <code>DbgPtrOffsetInBits</code> + <code>DbgExtractOffsetInBits</code>.

It is intended that these arguments are derived from a debug record:
<ul>
<li><code>DbgPtr</code> is the (single) <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a> operand.</li>
<li><code>DbgPtrOffsetInBits</code> is the constant offset applied to <code>DbgPtr</code>.</li>
<li><code>DbgExtractOffsetInBits</code> is the offset from a DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;bit&#95;extract&#95;&#91;sz&#93;ext operation.</li>
</ul>


Results and return value:
<ul>
<li>Return false if the result can&#39;t be calculated for any reason.</li>
<li><code>Result</code> is set to nullopt if the intersect equals <code>VarFarg</code>.</li>
<li><code>Result</code> contains a zero-sized fragment if there&#39;s no intersect.</li>
<li><code>OffsetFromLocationInBits</code> is set to the difference between the first bit of the variable location and the first bit of the slice. The magnitude of a negative value therefore indicates the number of bits into the variable fragment that the memory region begins.</li>
</ul>


We don&#39;t pass in a debug record directly to get the constituent parts and offsets because different debug records store the information in different places (dbg&#95;assign has two DIExpressions - one contains the fragment info for the entire intrinsic).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h/#l03154">3154</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h">DebugInfoMetadata.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfometadata-cpp/#l02099">2099</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfometadata-cpp">DebugInfoMetadata.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### createFragmentExpression() {#ab2fc167f75191e1d22e12e8e382605bb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; DIExpression &#42; &gt; DIExpression::createFragmentExpression (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a> &#42; Expr, unsigned OffsetInBits, unsigned SizeInBits)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Create a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a> to describe one part of an aggregate variable that is fragmented across multiple Values.

The DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;fragment operation will be appended to the elements of <code>Expr</code>. If <code>Expr</code> already contains a <code>DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;fragment</code> <code>OffsetInBits</code> is interpreted as an offset into the existing fragment.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="OffsetInBits">Offset of the piece in bits.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="SizeInBits">Size of the piece in bits.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
Creating a fragment expression may fail if <code>Expr</code> contains arithmetic operations that would be truncated.
</SectionUser>

</MemberDefinition>

### isEqualExpression() {#a3e2210b0af48ac382a4986510d1406bc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool DIExpression::isEqualExpression (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a> &#42; FirstExpr, bool FirstIndirect, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a> &#42; SecondExpr, bool SecondIndirect)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Determines whether two debug values should produce equivalent DWARF expressions, using their DIExpressions and directness, ignoring the differences between otherwise identical expressions in variadic and non-variadic form and not considering the debug operands.

<code>FirstExpr</code> is the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a> for the first debug value. <code>FirstIndirect</code> should be true if the first debug value is indirect; in IR this should be true for dbg.declare intrinsics and false for dbg.values, and in MIR this should be true only for DBG&#95;VALUE instructions whose second operand is an immediate value. <code>SecondExpr</code> and <code>SecondIndirect</code> have the same meaning as the prior arguments, but apply to the second debug value.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h/#l03010">3010</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h">DebugInfoMetadata.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfometadata-cpp/#l01664">1664</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfometadata-cpp">DebugInfoMetadata.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### replaceArg() {#a9c14a49c489d623a8174f48b368cd3e8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DIExpression &#42; DIExpression::replaceArg (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diexpression">DIExpression</a> &#42; Expr, uint64&#95;t OldArg, uint64&#95;t NewArg)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Create a copy of <code>Expr</code> with each instance of <code>DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg, \\p OldArg</code> replaced with <code>DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg, \\p NewArg</code>, and each instance of <code>DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg, Arg</code> with <code>DW&#95;OP&#95;LLVM&#95;arg, Arg - 1</code> for all Arg &gt; <code>OldArg</code>.

This is used when replacing one of the operands of a debug value list with another operand in the same list and deleting the old operand.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h/#l03090">3090</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debuginfometadata-h">DebugInfoMetadata.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfometadata-cpp/#l01893">1893</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfometadata-cpp">DebugInfoMetadata.cpp</a>.
